text:
News Releases

Payroll employment rises by 678,000 in February; unemployment rate edges down to 3.8% Total nonfarm payroll employment rose by 678,000 in February, and the unemployment rate edged down to 3.8 percent. Job growth was widespread, led by gains in leisure and hospitality, professional and business services, health care, and construction.

| | | |

Real average hourly earnings for all employees decrease 0.8% in February Real average hourly earnings for all employees decreased 0.8 percent in February, seasonally adjusted. Average hourly earnings were essentially unchanged and CPI-U increased 0.8 percent. Real average weekly earnings decreased 0.5 percent over the month.

| |

Next Release

The Employment Situation for March 2022 is scheduled to be released on April 1, 2022, at 8:30 A.M. Eastern Time.

Real Earnings for March 2022 is scheduled to be released on April 12, 2022, at 8:30 A.M. Eastern Time.
title: CES (National) : U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics
